p: The assay was conducted as described by Chen et al. [ 26]. 2 mL of a serial extract concentrations in ethanol and 2 mL of ethanol for control sample were added to equal volume of a DPPH solution in ethanol (2.10 –4 M) and incubated for 30 min in the dark at room temperature. The absorbance of the samples was measured at 517 nm using ethanol as a blank. The radical scavenging activity was expressed as IC 50 ( μg/ml) which is the concentration providing the inhibition of 50% DPPH radicals. The inhibition percentage of free radicals was determined based on the equation: %inhibition = [1– AS/AC] × 100, where AC and AS are the absorbance of the control and the tested sample respectively at t = 30 min.
